Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band around rim and glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: reserved with pre-firing dipinto inscription.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two concentric white bands (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 740, no. 1000)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 100, no. 303.3, pl. XXXII, no. 303.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1868) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5909 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
